Philippe and Sofia were great hosts. They were quick with responses and had a book of recommendations at the apartment. The apartment looked exactly as pictured - very charming. The bed was comfortable and the window AC unit worked very well and cooled the room to the desired temperature within minutes. The best part was the location! It’s directly across from a cute little beach where the snorkeling was fantastic!

Good place to stay. Pool was nice and by the beach. Slow at responding though, and forwarded our calls to voicemail the day we were arriving—made us think we had fallen for an AirBnB scam plus we had tickets for something we were hurrying to get to. All good in the end though. Maybe we caught them on a bad day.
Wonderful and convenient location.  the bed was so comfortable which was such a bonus! Very thoughtful touches throughout the apartment

Philippe and Sofia’s was great! It was just like the pictures. 
Kihei is a bit quieter, but if that is what you are looking for, then you will love it! I especially liked how they supplied beach gear like towels and chairs. They also suggested some great restaurants and things to do. 
It’s within walking distance to a few restaurants  and a grocery store. We really liked staying there.
Great location. Amazing amenities. They have beach chairs, snorkeling gear, beach towels. Their bed is so comfy. Sofia and Phillip was very responsive.
AMAZING HOST. There was an issue on my part of checking out but they were very understanding and super accommodating. A super cozy location with plenty of privacy.

Condo was as expected! The check in process was very easy, Philippe and Sofia were quick to respond, and the place was very clean. It was in a great location in Kihei, with the beach right across the street.

We were a bit warm at night, even with the AC and fan going, but that might be our cold Canadian blood. 

Good value for Maui!

We really enjoyed staying at this place. It’s in a great location near nice beaches and restaurants. Philippe and Sofia also provided us with beach chairs, towels, mats, and a cooler which were very helpful. We definitely recommend this place.

We had a fantastic stay at Philippe and Sofia’s place. There was so much to do between relaxing in the pool and spa and visiting the beach which is right across the road. The kitchen was also good so that we could occasionally cook when we were sick of eating out.

Philippe and Sofia's place was a great stay. When we got there, everything was set up for 2 people. The place was clean, and welcoming. the complex has a BBQ and pool. It is also located right across from the beach. We loved the location. It is conveniently located with everything you need nearby (Safeway, restaurants, etc). Kihei has a great mix of people and isnt overwhelming. I would highly recommend staying at Philippe and Sofia's place.

This place is in a great location. If you want to see turtles and enjoy the view of whales swimming while you sip of your morning coffee, this is the place for you. This condo is located across from Kalepolepo beach. There is tons of turtles there. 
The condo is very clean. It’s small but it has everything you need.
This was a great place to stay in Kihei. The location was excellent, right across the street from the beach. Check-in was super easy and everything was clean and ready for us when we arrived!
Had a great stay at Philippe and Sofia’s place!
Place was just as described in the photos and right across from the beach

Philippe and Sofia’s place was perfect for my husband and I. The home was in a great location in Kihei. Close enough to a beach for us to hop across the street to watch the sunset from. They left us beach towels to use, a cooler, and snorkel gear which made it so easy for us to pack up and go! The beach chairs were also an excellent addition to our Big Beach days - which took us only twenty minutes to get to from our place. The bed was so soft and comfortable and everything was very clean and neat. A lovely place to stay for a vacation! We highly recommend this vacation home to everyone!

name: High Quality App + rooftop in trendy central area
summary: Cozy, high quality 2-room apartment in renovated traditional HK town house in famous and trendy Star Street Neighbourhood. Three balconies and large roof top terrace. The apartment has high quality fittings and equipment. Very central location. Seven min. indoor walk plus one metro stop from Central station as well as TST. The area has many trendy restaurants, wine bars and design shops and is next to Wan Chai market and Pacific Place Shopping Mall.
space: My place is great for couples visiting HK and/or business travellers.
description: Cozy, high quality 2-room apartment in renovated traditional HK town house in famous and trendy Star Street Neighbourhood. Three balconies and large roof top terrace. The apartment has high quality fittings and equipment. Very central location. Seven min. indoor walk plus one metro stop from Central station as well as TST. The area has many trendy restaurants, wine bars and design shops and is next to Wan Chai market and Pacific Place Shopping Mall. My place is great for couples visiting HK and/or business travellers. Private rooftop terrace. I prefer communication by e-mail, (Hidden by Airbnb) and (Hidden by Airbnb) . The neighbourhood has many trendy restaurants and design boutiques. It is popular for after-work drinks and dinners as well as weekend lunching, shopping, strolling and picture taking. It gets quiet after 10 pm in the evenings. - 2 minutes walk to Queens Road East from which busses go to Central and Mid-level escalators (5 min), Causeway Bay (7 min), The Peak (20 min), R
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood has many trendy restaurants and design boutiques. It is popular for after-work drinks and dinners as well as weekend lunching, shopping, strolling and picture taking. It gets quiet after 10 pm in the evenings.
notes: Please kindly note that the apartment does not have a dining or writing table (except for the outdoor table on the rooftop terrace.)
transit: - 2 minutes walk to Queens Road East from which busses go to Central and Mid-level escalators (5 min), Causeway Bay (7 min), The Peak (20 min), Repulse Bay Beach (25 min), Stanley Village (30 min). - 7 minutes indoor walk to Admiralty Metro Station from where I stop to Central Station as well as 1 stop to TST (in Kowloon) station. Admiralty is the best connected metro station in Hong Kong with the (Blue) Island Line, (Red) Tsuen Wan Line and (Green) South Island Line crossing at this station. - Plenty of taxi's stops at this popular neighbourhood.  - Destinations in Wan Chai and Admiralty are all in walking distance.
access: Private rooftop terrace.
interaction: I prefer communication by e-mail, (Hidden by Airbnb) and (Hidden by Airbnb) .

host.host_about: My favourite travel destinations are in Asia,  Europe and Africa. I appreciate historic cities as well as nature. I like meeting people from different cultures and practice sailing, travelling, hiking, reading and swimming as hobbies. I value fairness, honesty and respectfulness.

address.street: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: Great place !! Once of the best I've stayed at in HK. Spotless, great location, great host! Would definitely stay again or rent longer term ! Thanks Klaas-Jan and Jennet.
Apartment well located and well equipped in the center of Hong Kong. I recommend without any hesitation.

KJ's place is cosy and everything was well take care of. The apartment was located in a best part of town, right next to cool restaurants and bars. KJ is a great host as he is constantly in touch with you to sort out every detail regarding his place. The kitchen is not huge but It has everything required to make a decent meal. And also, 3 balconies!
Awesome stylie apartment, great location, few good places to eat an hang around
My favorite Airbnb apartment in HK.:)
I would choose this place again!
Great host with a great spot in a quiet haven in a busy part of the town.
Nice location and impressive decoration. Should be highly recommended.
Had a fantastic stay as always! Thanks again!
Great space in a trendy neighborhood. Walkable to downtown. Had great amenities.

KJ's flat is at one of the best locations in Hong Kong -- the neighborhood is very convenient and stylish and full of great restaurants, pubs and shops. Very close to public transportation as well. One of the best things about his place is its spacious rooftop! KJ is a considerate host, quick to respond and easy to communicate. Highly recommend his flat.

We had a lovely five nights here.  The apartment is very nice and spacious by Hong Kong standards.  It is well furnished and spotlessly clean.  The roof terrace was a nice spot for coffee in the morning.  The apartment is very well located near to admiralty / Pacific place with supermarkets near by.  Klaas-Jan was very helpful and responsive to messages and provided lots of useful tips.

첫 에어비앤비 이용이라 반신반의 했었는데, 생각했던 것 보다 완전 좋아요. 4박 했는데, 아늑하고 깨끗하고 ... 무엇보다 호스트의 배려가 있어 편안하게 잘 보냈습니다. 체크아웃할때 저는 집에 정이 들어 아쉽더군요ㅜㅜ 
아 참, 주변에 예쁜 와인바들과 음식점, 카페가 있어요. 저는 시간이 없어 이용은 못해봤지만 다 멋지고 좋아보였어요. 추천추천
High end apartment in an amazing location. 5 stars!
위치도 너무 좋고 호스트분도 너무 친절하셨어요! 주변에 분위기 좋은 와인바가 많으니 꼭 이용해보세요! (참고로 샤워실은 투명한 문으로 되어있습니다)

Beautiful apartment; great location. Its quite apparent that they've spent a lot of time thinking about how to maximize the utility of the apartment for their guests. Thank you very much for a comfortable stay.

name: City Studio - Lan Kwai Fong, Central
summary: **This is a 4th floor walk-up, no elevator. LOUD sounds from bars and restaurants until 6am.** This flat is located in the heart of the Entertainment District in Lan Kwai Fong, Central, Hong Kong.  It gets NOISY especially Friday and Saturday nights until early hours of the morning when people are out having fun.  Though not a place for light sleepers, it is suitable for guests looking for a convenient night out with bars and restaurants right below. Definitely a great spot for a few nights!
space: A great place to crash after a long night out.
description: **This is a 4th floor walk-up, no elevator. LOUD sounds from bars and restaurants until 6am.** This flat is located in the heart of the Entertainment District in Lan Kwai Fong, Central, Hong Kong.  It gets NOISY especially Friday and Saturday nights until early hours of the morning when people are out having fun.  Though not a place for light sleepers, it is suitable for guests looking for a convenient night out with bars and restaurants right below. Definitely a great spot for a few nights! A great place to crash after a long night out. Whole studio unit to yourself. We usually meet our guests outside the Hard Rock Cafe, before checking them in. It is just a few steps from our flat and easy to find. Lan Kwai Fong is a lively place to be, lots of bars and restaurants. A short 5-minute walk to the underground train - Central MTR Station. The same to the tram stop. Taxi is available just outside the building. Buses nearby too. A 10-minute walk to Airport Express Hong Kong Station. This i
neighborhood_overview: Lan Kwai Fong is a lively place to be, lots of bars and restaurants.
notes: This is a 4th floor walk-up.  A non-smoking apartment building. As we are in the heart of Lan Kwai Fong, it gets noisy especially Friday and Saturday nights until early hours of the morning when people are out having fun.
transit: A short 5-minute walk to the underground train - Central MTR Station. The same to the tram stop. Taxi is available just outside the building. Buses nearby too. A 10-minute walk to Airport Express Hong Kong Station.
access: Whole studio unit to yourself.
interaction: We usually meet our guests outside the Hard Rock Cafe, before checking them in. It is just a few steps from our flat and easy to find.

host.host_about: I live and work in Hong Kong.  I love to travel whenever I get a chance.

address.street: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments: Ling is a very friendly and helpful host.  Location is perfect if you are into the HK party scene.  Not for the light sleeper or if you are not fond of crowds.  Very helpful host would stay there again.
Easy to find once you figure out where you are. Lots of hills and steps so get your quads ready. Can be a bit noisy as expected. Nothing that he local bars can’t help with.
I would definitely stay here again! So convenient for going out in Central and getting to ferries or mtr. Ling is so sweet too!
Excellent location for those looking for fun
Thank you very much for your kind response! It was a perfect location to go to the club!

Great location.
Great atmosphere.
Great equipment.
And great reception.
If you’re also a night live mania person, and this might be your first choice.
Had a great stay at Ling’s apartment. It is right in Lan Kwai Fong and is great value for money. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again

Apartment was much more spacious than I expected seeing as how space is at a premium in Hong Kong. Location is a double edged sword since it's in the heart of Lan Kwai Fong the party central of Hong Kong but also very noisy at night. Great place to stay if you want to unwind and party in Hong Kong. Would definitely come back.
good deal
Great accommodation.  The apartment was in a very good location and handy to everything I wanted in hong kong. Check in and communication was great. Thank you Ling

Ling was a very accommodating to our travel plans as our flights got delayed. Ling aldo kindly gave us very straightforward abd helpful directions on how to get from HKIA to her apartment at minimum cost. Overall a great place to stay, very local. Would love to stay at her apartment again.

The two main advantages of the City Studio are its location and that it’s rather spacious for a place in the heart of Lan Kwai Fong. The disadvantages are several. The place definitely is not kept up. Once we were in our room we found the AC didn’t work, the shower drain wouldn’t drain and the fan was broken. The TV isn’t hooked up to any cable so you have a large television that you can’t watch. We found this all to be very disappointing.
Upon arriving in Lan Kwai Fong at 1:00 pm we went to the meeting place in front of the Hard Rock Cafe and gave the Indonesian caretaker 
Ling a call saying we had arrived and were waiting for her. She said she was eating lunch and would be there soon. After waiting with our luggage in the street Ling finally showed up 2 hours later at 3:00. We found her to be surly, arrogant and unpleasant to deal with. We most definitely will not stay there again.
Room is nice, but it's really for party people who don't sleep at night.

nice place, a bit small. very good location for night people, a lot of bars/ pubs/ restaurants right downstairs. keep in mind that all the bars/ pubs/ restaurants are for tourists and can get expensive, you might want to walk a few blocks over and find some authentic places. not a good location for light sleepers, gets very noisy weekdays and weekends
Ling’s place is probably the best location for those seeking a pad right in the beating heart of HK nightlife. The place was very clean and Ling was extremely helpful throughout our stay!

quite spacious apartment for HK standards (i think). Communication with Ling went perfect,  was very early but could drop of luggage and hav a shower. apartment has a very good location, my recommendations: visit the central police station and pmq,  all walking distances, easy to get to the mtr.
everything good but very noisy from LKF. very kind host
It is a nice and clean place. Ling is also helpful.
Ling’s place was great! Central location and right above LKF. Ling was also very responsive and accommodating. Would recommend!
Ling’s place is very cozy and had all the essentials to make our stay comfortable. She always responded quickly and even helped us with the directions to get there.

Ling's place is ultra central right in the heart of the night-life district, buzzing with late night bars and food options within walking distance. As others have commented, it's not for those who are light sleepers, especially on the weekend, with the party extending up until dawn and beyond, but if you're in Hong Kong to take advantage of the vibrant night life, there are few places better located on the island. My visit coincided with typhoon Mangkhut blowing past, felling trees and breaking windows, but Ling kept me updated with information coming out of the Hong Kong Observatory, ensuring I kept dry and safe. 

It's worth keeping in mind that the place is pretty small though adequate by Hong Kong standards, and is great as a base for exploring, and you'll want to spend more time out and about than in the confines of the four walls. That said it's good value and ideal for a weekend or couple of days.
Highly recommend staying, I will be back

This place is cozy and Ling was very friendly and helpful! I stayed during the weekend before mid autumn so as I expected it was a bit noisy. But over all is a great place and I had a good time! Thank you Ling !
Little bit nosie at night but I wasn't care it. This room is very great spot and easy to go anywhere by walk.

I caught the Airport Express train from the airport for $150HK and I was Met at the Hong Kong Central station by Ling’s friend and we walked all the way uphill, he carried my heavy suitcase all the way and up 4 flights of stairs to my room. 
The room is located Above a 24 hour 7/11 convenient store and at the very top of the hill next to Hard Rock Cafe and all the nightclubs and action.
Mcdonalds is 2 mins walk downhill was the first food place,i could find..
Perfect location, Zoo is a short walk away. 
Good exercise there. Walking the hills. HK is full of hills. 
Ling is a great hostess and i would definitely recommend her place.

It has some noise, from crazy chinese drivers tooting their horns in the morning rush hour traffic.
But i just closed the window to minimise the sound. 
Shower is super pressure and roomy.
Its compact and all i needed there, especially a wardrobe to hang my clothes and drawers etc.
Secure and safe.
Nice price, good location, very noisy at night(do not imagine, it’s noisier than you think) but calm in the day time. Clean but little bit humid.
Ling responded quickly to all of my messages, the apartment was clean and nice, and the location was perfect.

If you’re going out at night, especially on the weekend, this is a prime location!  The Central Station MTR is also very easy to get to from here, tho there is an slight uphill climb to the place. It wasn’t as loud as I expected it to be at night, but bring earplugs just in case.

Ling was amazing with responding quickly and if timing permits with other tenants, checkin and checkout time can be a little flexible, which was extremely helpful for me. The Airbnb has everything I needed and I wouldn’t mind staying here again!
Great location for food and bars. Convenient access to the MTR and the Peak.

Apartment was good, small and cozy. Everything corresponded to the description on Airbnb. The place is very close to Central metro station and that is very convenient. There is 7eleven near the enter, so you can bye anything urgent. The host is very responsive, helpful and flexible. 
The only big disadvantage - loud music on street during the night from the different clubs and bars.
Would recommend it
Place is nice. Straight forward. Easy check in and out.

The studio was clean and contained everything you need for few days. The location is just perfect for those who comes for night life in Hong Kong. 
Aloha was very friendly and gave a detailed explanation for the way to the studio. 
Would definitely recommend it!
Very nice!
Aloha is a great host. They are always up for any kind of help that you need. Also, the place is amazing for party people. Over all c for money

Aloha's place's location is awesome for sightseeing central HK, public transport is near and all the most important sights in walking distance - but it can get really noisy at night, as it is right above the biggest party spot in the area! We stayed for NYE and the volume of the music from the nearby clubs and bars was amazibhly loud!! ;D it kept us up for a bit but on weekday nights the noise level was ok. The flat itself is small but clean and has everything you need. Fridge is very small and the bed is not good if you have any back problems (too soft!).
месторасположение идеальное! но берите с собой беруши.
This place was perfect! Definitely good place for party lovers and host was really respectful!

Aloha is easy to communicate with, and the place is centrally located. Their place is very cleanly kept, and we were greeted when we arrived.(Aloha's boyfriend carried our luggage)  As long as you can tolerate the loud noise (it IS a party destination where they party until 6AM!) then it is a great deal. There are more places to shop and eat within walking distance, than you'll ever need!
Great and helpful host, fast response

Aloha's place was very nice. It was clean and felt very comfortable. The location is good, however, it certainly did get quite loud at night. I am grateful that Aloha was up front about this and we brought earplugs and were prepared.
Great location in the centre of the city, perfect for anyone who is planning to experience the nightlife

Aloha’s place was great. They were definitely not joking about the noise, but we expected it going in as this unit is right in the middle of the action. The place is convenient to both Hong Kong station and Central station which was wonderful. A/C worked very well. One thing to note for this unit is even though the curtains are drawn, the unit feels very bright no matter what time of day or night. Overall, this place is well worth the 4 flights of stairs.
Great value in THE BEST location in HK. If you are a light sleeper the noise on the weekends might disturb you but it was just fine for me.

Aloha's place is located in the heart of Lan Kwai Fong, which is a very exciting place. The bars are open until the early hours and there are lots of eating places close by.
The apartment is well described by Aloha, it is great value for money, it is clean and plenty of towels, soaps etc were provided.
Communication from Aloha was excellent and she very kindly allowed us to check out late on our last day. Thanks for that and for a great stay.
Excellent location as a base to explore Hong Kong.  Aloha provides speedy responses and a tidy room in a very lively part of town.

name: Hawaiian Jungle Hut
space: Hawaiian Jungle Hut is the ohana next to Hawaiian Jungle Hangout with a separate entrance.  Rustic and cute, the hut is perfect for a couple or single guest who need a home base while exploring the island. Having it's own full bathroom, living room, inside washer and dryer, and kitchenette with tiki bar.  The hut is also wireless and cable connected.  No phone and no stove.  There is a shared outside gas grill.   Three miles from the ocean, and a mile from the main highway, Hawaiian Jungle Hut offers easy access to eastside highlights--20 minutes from Ahalanui Beach Park (a naturally warmed 95 degree seawater pond), 35 minutes from Volcano National Park, 20 minutes from Hilo airport, 10 minutes from Keaau town, and 10 minutes from Pahoa Village.   Price reflects the total price with state tax and local transient taxes--%13.416. Cleaning fee ($50) is not charged when home is left well and very close to found.
description: Hawaiian Jungle Hut is the ohana next to Hawaiian Jungle Hangout with a separate entrance.  Rustic and cute, the hut is perfect for a couple or single guest who need a home base while exploring the island. Having it's own full bathroom, living room, inside washer and dryer, and kitchenette with tiki bar.  The hut is also wireless and cable connected.  No phone and no stove.  There is a shared outside gas grill.   Three miles from the ocean, and a mile from the main highway, Hawaiian Jungle Hut offers easy access to eastside highlights--20 minutes from Ahalanui Beach Park (a naturally warmed 95 degree seawater pond), 35 minutes from Volcano National Park, 20 minutes from Hilo airport, 10 minutes from Keaau town, and 10 minutes from Pahoa Village.   Price reflects the total price with state tax and local transient taxes--%13.416. Cleaning fee ($50) is not charged when home is left well and very close to found.
house_rules: No smoking in the house.

host.host_about: Since venturing to the Big Island 15 years ago, I've always been drawn to the volcano, warm springs, and rainforest. As a documentary photographer for over two decades, the 15 different microclimates delight in an ever changing offering of surreal landscapes, diversity of character and faces, exotic/colorful fauna, and island politics, gives a profuse array of visual opportunities and is a photographer's paradise. I feel fortunate to have a home located minutes from all my favorite sites and love having the opportunity to share the experience.

reviews.comments:
JungleHut was amazing! We were right in the middle of the jungle 5 minutes away from the highway.
Decoration was so nice! 
And Liz was very friendly and warm welcoming
Definitely, we will come again!
The host canceled my reservation 8 days before arrival.

Wow. All the luxury of a house in a subdivision but literally at the end of the road and in the middle of a rainforest. The grounds are beautifully landscaped like a garden iof Eden. Fruit trees of every kind, many producing additions to our breakfast.  The owner provided everything we needed to enjoy the island, from recommendations on gas, food, restaurants, parks, sights and local hangouts to the snorkeling, boogie boards, beach mats, and beach towels. We didn't need to bring anything except our clothes and primary foods.. Two couples or a family of four could be comfortable here, for the two of us it was very tranquil.

We had a wonderful time at the JungleHut. Very nice place at the end of the road, right next to the jungle with all its sounds. Well equipped flat, nice surroundings, great support by owner when we had trouble with wi-fi. We can absolutely recommend this place. MJC

The space smelled musty and was not clean. I did not feel comfortable there due to the dampness, mold and dirt. I did not use the kitchen - the sink was a dirty looking laundry tub. People were staying in the other unit and could see into our sleeping quarters since there were only sheers at some of the windows. The neighbourhood this property is in was also a little scarey i.e. chain link fences around the properties and beware of vicious dog signs. I was also told by some of the locals that this was not a safe neighbourhood. Overall the property was run down and in need of alot of TLC and cleaner. I never saw the host -she only communicated via e-mail so was not available to address any problems. I would not stay there again and would suggest that others skip this experience.

The jungle hut is a large studio on the ground floor which is part of a 2-story house. The entire property is amazing; located in the rainforest, the property overall is full of life: fruit trees, plants, flowers, nice decorations, etc. just like a jungle! 

The property is 2-2.5 hrs drive from Kona and 20 mins from Hilo.

The studio is equipped with a very large bathroom with lots of towels, kitchenette, laundry units, a queen size bed and a very spacious living area with a big expandable sofa and a large futon which is closer to the kitchenette area. It is a perfect choice if you like nature and would like to be away from the busy city life. The owner, Liz, allowed access to gear for beach activities like snorkels, fins and boogie boards. There is also a beach shower outside next to the house. Covered parking is available as well, so even if you are in a rainforest you do not need to get wet on your way out or in. Liz is very friendly, knowledgeable and willing to help with any questions or concerns. We took her advice during our visit and it was worth it! She knows to guide your way into the local life and island's attractions. She is very welcoming! Mahalo Liz! 

I would definitely stay here again and i highly recommend this property for your stay in Big Island.

Lovely quiet vacation spot! Nice eclectic decor, which we loved.
Clean and homely thank you Liz for all of your suggestions & hospitality.
Took a bit to find the champagne ponds but we got there eventually :D
Can't wait to vist Hawaii again. Would definitely stay here again too.
Cheers & Mahalo

I really enjoyed staying at Liz's place.  The only challenge we had was finding the location in the dark (the directions were great but signs on the road and streets were difficult to read and there were no street lights).  Once we got there it was easy to navigate back and forth.
     The place was great and big enough for a family to enjoy with most of the conveniences of home.
Liz was a fabulous host.  Went up and above what we expected. There was even umbrella's for us to use. Free water to drink, washer and dryer to use. It was real nice,cozy and remote.

really enjoyed our stay in the jungle ! Liz was really wellcoming and made things to make you feel home.
Puna region is really to be known in Big Island.
Great place to stay. As the name says, it is in the rainforest. Really quiet during the day, very noisy at night, with birds everywhere around you. Really loved it!

The Hawaiian Jungle Hut is as advertised, complete with lychee and coconut tree in the backyard!  This is a unique guesthouse located between Hilo and Volcanoes Natl Park that places you in the wilderness.  We truly enjoyed visiting the nearby Kapoho Tide Pools (snorkel gear provided by host) and enjoyed the peaceful solitude.

Liz made sure we had everything we needed. Her house is truly in the rainforest, since there is nothing but wilderness beyond her property, yet it is close to the main road. I really like the home’s eclectic Asian décor. The yard is very private and landscaped with beautiful tropical plants and trees, including a gorgeous rainbow eucalyptus tree, coconuts, passion fruit, avocado, and oranges. The kitchen is fully equipped and we especially appreciated the new gas stove, which made cooking our own meals easier. The in-unit washer & dryer also came in handy.
Great stay!

Great place! The name is Jungle "Hut" but it is anything but a "hut"! I could easily have stayed and lived out my days here! The "hut" has a full kitchen, spacious living room, single bedroom (but also a futon in the space between the living room and kitchen), and sizable bathroom. And to fall asleep in the jungle to the cuqui frogs' singing is like falling asleep to nature's lullaby! I cannot wait to stay here again! 
(FYI...a bit of a challenge to find in the dark, so try to arrive in daylight, keeping in mind sunset hits early in Hilo. If you are arriving after dark, the left turn onto Maku'u is exactly as Liz says - 1.0 miles after Paradise Drive. If you've gone 1.3 miles, you've gone too far. I say this because at the time I was there - October 2012 - the street sign warning of Maku'u, when coming from Hilo, was bent and really scuffed up so much as to be illegible.)

The jungle hut is a beautiful place that feels quite secluded in a jungle setting. Liz provides all the basics and she sent us a wealth of useful information on possible activities nearby. One thing you should be aware of is that it is well outside of Hilo (about 20-25min dirve) but close to the funky village of Pahoe.

Liz was a highly communicative and hospitable host.  The apartment was clean and it was great to have a kitchen, laundry, and tons of towels.  Liz would get more stars as a host, but we gave two stars because the rainy side was way rainier than we expected which made our stay in the Jungle Hut pretty disappointing.

Unfortunately, it rained most of the time we were in Hilo (which is not at all uncommon, especially in December), so make sure you understand how different the sunny and rainy sides are on the Big Island.  Also, because of the constant rain the apartment felt, and smelled,  damp and musty.  The bed is also under an uninsulated section of awning so the rain was really loud on the roof, which made it hard to sleep.

We chose Hilo to be near the Volcanoes and to stay for less money, but we weren't in Hawaii for cool wet weather, so we ended up leaving the Jungle Hut for the Kona Coast for three days where we had perfect, sunny weather.  We regretted not spending our whole trip in Kona (or elsewhere on the sunny side) and making a day excursion to Volcanoes N.P.

Hilo might be your thing, just make sure it is before you book a place on the rainy side.

The Hawaiin Jungle hut was a great and nice place to explore big island! The house was very clean and very comfortable!Liz was not on the spot, but gave us a lot of information on farmers markets, restaurants, events, etc.? She was really nice!
Unfortunately, it has often been raining so we did not 8 days but only stayed 5 days and then went to the West Coast.
I can only recommend liz as host! Thank you!
Cozy apartment, lots of room with a glorious bed. The jungle noise at night is the best thing to fall asleep to!

Very positive experience staying in Liz's Jungle Hut-  it's secluded, spacious, comfortable and displays a distinct style, while offering easy access to the Hilo area.

Furnishing and the amount of space were great- there's a likable personal style as you can see from the pics.  I was a single and had more room than I needed- the place could easily accommodate several more people and I'm definitely sure a couple would enjoy it.  I've gone so far as to suggest it as an away base for a friend who's staying on the Kona side on her upcoming honeymoon.  Though I didn't make much use of it, the kitchen was very well outfitted and would be great for longer stays.  On site laundry and instant hot water in the showers was greatly appreciated.  I spent one particularly rainy day mostly inside working and napping, and it was cool and dry- awesome.

The rainforest location is wonderful- I loved having all the frogs singing at night and being able to walk around the property during the day and see local wildlife.  At the same time, it's very well located. making it easy to get to Hilo, Kalapana and the lava flows/Uncle Robert's, the eastern side of the saddle road, and Volcano.  I'd recommend it as a great base for visiting the eastern side of the island.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Jungle Hut. The location was both away from everything and close to everything. We enjoyed the rain forrest atmosphere while the house itself was secure and critters were never seen inside.
The house was perfectly located between Hilo and the Volcanoes National Park with minimal driving needed to get to all the sites.
Liz provided great suggestions and advice on what to do and see and provided all the equipment we needed including snorkel gear, flashlights and umbrellas. The house had a well equiped kitchen and was clean and well decorated.
Thank you Liz for a great stay!

We stayed 3 nights at Liz's place and we totally loved it. The house is located in a very quiet area, full of trees and frogs. That's the only thing you will hear at night!!! Amazing!!!
Liz was extremely helpful from the beginning with directions, suggestions and plans for what to do every day. We will keep all her suggestions for future trips. The locations is really convenient to discover the Volcanic Ntl Park, to see the lava flow if you are lucky and do some amazing snorkeling (she provides all the gear for snorkeling).
Don't trust (Hidden by Airbnb) maps for the locations...just follow her directions to the house!!! Hope you will enjoy your stay there as much as we did!

The location was perfect as we wanted to have easy access to Hilo, the National Park, Mauna Kea, and the southeastern part of The Big Island.  The Jungle Hut is beautifully decorated with excellent amenities.  We really enjoyed being able to cook a breakfast and eat fresh fruit every morning before heading out for another adventure.  Liz went above and beyond as an exceptional hostess.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

My parents came for a visit  , I rented for them liz's place.
They felt very special sleeping in a middle of a rain forest, they really loved how the apartment was designed and cannot stopped talking about how Liz left the bottle of wine and chocolates . 
They highly recommend Liz and the place .

We visited the Hawaiian Jungle Hut during our stay in Hawaii. It was in close proximity to where we got married in Orchidland Estates. Our stay was comfortable and well-suited to our needs. We even found chocolates and a bottle of wine upon our arrival. Liz supplied us with very helpful information about the area and activities beforehand, and there's 2 absolutely gorgeous and amazing Rainbow Eucalyptus trees on the property that you must see! mahalo

We didn't meet Liz in person but she did email us LOTS of info about things to do in the area, including good places to eat and who to talk to about current lava flows. The jungle hut itself was great (and clean) - looks just like in the pictures. It does now have a stove (with a propane tank), though we didn't end up doing any cooking. The jungle sound at night is amazing, but mosquitoes do get in through the screen door and they are relentless (we ended up turning AC on instead). Take a drive to the end of Makuu st as well where you can get to the coast and watch the ocean. It is breathtaking. Overall I'd say this is a great location if you want a cottage-y vacay that is relaxed and away from everything. We were mostly in and out because we wanted to see what the island had to offer.

I stayed at the Jungle Hut for three nights. Actually it's more like a mini-cottage than a hut :) It has everything you need - from washer to propane stove - and is large enough to feel comfortably. Also liked the interior.

As for Liz - she's a great host. Though she didn't show up during my stay, she provided VERY detailed directions to the hut, instructions of how to use it and suggestions about what to see on the Big Island.

So, if you're looking for some home to make your base - choose this one. You'll get an excellent place to relax between your travels across the island. 

Mahalo Liz :)

The house is very cosy and the stay feels very secluded (and the outskirt of a private home development area). The kitchen is fuctional even if small and there was lots of drinking water provided  for our stay plus a bottle of wine and some chocolates.
Communication with the owner was easy and she provided lots of info about daytrips in the area.
Only drawback is that you share the two-flat house with other visitors. If they have the upper flat it is quite noisy when they are in ( e.g. I woke up several times when they came back in the middle of the night).

This is a terrific place to stay. It's really more of a cottage (although one attached to another unit) than anything else. There's a huge amount of room and several people could sleep comfortably and happily between the bed, couch, and futon. It was hard to tell from the pictures, but there are really 3 main areas (kitchen, foyer/bedroom area, and living room) plus a walled-off bathroom. The kitchen/bedroom/living area are a very open floor plan.

Liz was a great host and sent us lots of information about day trips and activities in the Hilo and Volcano area. We didn't meet her personally, but spoke on the phone several times and got all details necessary for the stay. I would definitely recommend staying here if you're interested in exploring the east side of the big island. 

The only piece of advice I would give you when staying here is to find the place in the day for the first time. It's easy to drive here once you know how to find it, but the back roads and turns in Hawaiian Paradise Park can be easier to drive in the light for the first time. You'll probably also want to refill the drinking water bottles during the day (there's a station nearby where you can do that for free, but the previous guests hadn't been as considerate when we arrived). This is really not a problem, though, and we enjoyed our stay tremendously!

From the first contact with the host to the last one, all interactions with the host were prompt and highly useful. On the day of arrival, we were late. But the host had made all arrangements for easy access. The property was cleans and as described in the photos and notes. All amenities were of great help. We had a great stay for 3 nights. This property is in the midst of Rain forest. Every morning, we woke up to the chirping sound of beautiful birds. Property provided easy access to east side of the island. The tips and notes provided by the host were extremely useful. The host goes out of the way to help us and ensure that we see the best of the island. Highly commendable attitude. Highly recommend :)

An experience you never should miss !! It's really living in the jungle / rainforrest and its awesome !!!

The Jungle Hut is a really cozy, clean place, it feels like coming home to your very own vacation condo! If you like the sound of nature, this is the perfect spot! :-)

Liz provides you with extensive things-to-do and recommendations which you cannot find in the tourist guides !
Going from Hilo-side to the Kona side is easy using the Saddle Road and takes about 2.5 hours door-to-door from Downtown Kona.

We really enjoyed it and would go there again - even if you don't like the rainy Hilo-side it's worth staying there and drive to Kona in the morning !

Mahalo Liz! :-)

L'appartement est grand, décoré originalement et bien situé pour visiter le Volcano Park. L'endroit est calme et tranquille mais un peu isolé dans la foret. Il est bien équipé avec tout ce qui est nécessaire dans la cuisine et dans la salle de bain. Séjour agréable.

Amazing place! Liz provided us with many tips for activities and where to buy stuff. It was great experience in rain forrest.

Thank you Liz and to others - go for it, you will be happy as we were!
The Hawaiian Jungle Hut was great! I highly recommend it. Liz provided great information about the island and is super easy to work with.

Liz is a super host. She gave us a HUGE amount of advices of things to do in this side of the island and I think she really care about her guests. The place is nice and a very good value. It's easy to fill at home, there is some small lights every where that you can use to create a cosy atmosphere, and the extra towels was worth it too ! in term of location It's easy to go to the volcanoes, and my boyfriend find a surf spot not so far, but we find it a bit far from Hilo.
Thanks Liz for the chocolate and bottle of vine too, it was really really appreciated : )
Mahalo
Great spot - quiet and very welcoming community. Great communication from the host - actually responded to local attractions, recommended food stops that where more local than any guide book.

Hawaiian Jungle Hut is a spacious open plan studio attached to Hawaiian Jungle Hangout (which takes up the second storey of the home). The comfy and colourful interior has a strong Japanese/ Hawaiian influence. The Hut is set amongst lush tropical forest including passion fruit, star fruit and coconut trees. You will not meet Liz but she will give you plenty if advice via email and we had everything we needed. This is the perfect based to explore Puna, Volcano National Park, Mauna Kea and the East of the Big Island.

The Jungle Hut was a unique place to stay on the Hilo side of the island.  Liz did a great job with decorating the hut with all the amenities you need for a stay at guest home. You are truly staying in a rain forest surrounded by lush greenery, birds, and daily rain showers.  You're only 10 minutes away from a cute town with local food ad 20 minutes drive to Hilo. 
 
The only thing that bothered me was the mosquitoes.  Even with Deet and citronella candles, we both have  bites all over our bodies. Just be prepared and it shouldn't be an issue.  

Our overall stay was comfortable and relaxing.  Liz also gives a great list of things of activities on the island.  She practically helps you plan your whole trip.

I had some communication issues with Liz as we were request to sign a rental contract while we were already traveling to release us the door code, in the end just one day prior to arriving on her place we received the code… Her place is divided in 2, we stayed on the bottom part, it was very big, it had a big living room and big kitchen. The bathroom was good. There was a air conditioning by the bed, cable TV, full size kitchen, snorkel, laundry with soap, some DVD and books, you will have anything you need there, even more; there is a coffee maker but no free coffee. On the garden there was also passion and start fruit trees. The location is a little remote, about 15 miles to Hilo and the nearest market or food are about 7 miles away and at night was a bit challenging to find, but if you follow the instructions you should get there. The house smelled like have been closed for some time, and the living room and kitchen carpets smelled a little odd. Wi-fi worked very good. Also there was a very annoying alarm on the ceiling that kept beeping every 1 minute more or less

We stayed there for 4 nights. Nice flat, Barbecue And enough space. A bit outside of hilo, but at night it is so quiet. Very relaxed! Liz gives a Lot of advice. I would recommend to stay there but not for your whole stay on Big Island. Kona is 3 hours drive away. We had a good time! Thanks!

This place is absolutely awesome! We visited the islands for 4 weeks, and the last stop was the Big Island. Staying in the JungleHangout/JungleHut was the best conclusion of our vacation, we ever could dreamed of. This place is perfect! And Liz was so helpful and allways reachable via eMail. Thank you Liz for making our stay so pleasant!
Some facts:
- Many people stay on the more touristic westshore around Kona. The Hilo-Side may be more rainy, but much more adorable to my opinion. The people, the prices (of food or gas for example) and the most beautiful Farmes- and Night-Markets. Thumbs up for the Hilo-Side!
- Yes, nearly every evening you will hear the rain and the frogs and yes, both is surprisingly loud, but it was not disturbing at all. We loved it. And it was the best sleep we had since weeks. You're in the jungle there and it is beautiful!
- Liz is the most helpful person I allways talked to on AirBnB. It's a shame, that we couldn't meet in person, because she was out of the country at that time. Top1-Host!!!
So much more compliments to give, so less words left. JungleHangout and JungleHut are best of the best on the Hilo-Side of the Big Island!

This is a grat accommodation. There are fruit trees in the back and I got Star Fruit, Oranges and Mandarin's every day. It is quiet and all we could hear is the chirping of the frogs at night. The house is well equipped neat and clean. A bottle of wine awaited us on arrival and some chocolate, there was salt and some basic condiments for cooking which was much appreciated, The only thing, you need a car to stay there, it is a bit off the beaten path.
Great place! The house is clean and beautiful. We spent three days there. The landlord is very kind and always reachable. I will choose this place if we will go to the Big Island in the future.

Great stay. We explored the south east of the island from there, including the volcano park.. Location is convenient and the little town of pahoa - 5 min by car -  has nice restaurants -extra good fish and chips - and supermarket. 
The hut was comfortable, with some snorkel equipment to borrow. Liz sent us 2 extensive emails with  everything to see around. Was very good advice and helped us a lot.

While we never met Liz, she was awesome!

1) The place was even cooler than we expected!

2) Her directions were awesome, and entry and exit was painless

3) Her list of things to do was great! Especially her recommendation that we stay an extra night to catch the locals Wednesday night market. It was a blast! 

We would definitely stay here again!

Thanks Liz!
The place is great - a house hidden in the forest so that you can feel the atmospehere of the island. Close to the airport ;) Liz provided a lot of useful tips and advice via mail.
Great little spot close enough to Hilo and to Volcano. Nice touch to leave wine and chocolates for our arrival. Would stay again. Thanks!

Great place, amazing yard with stunning Rainbow Eucalyptus and a variety of beautiful foiliage, and a big spacious place for the money. It's really in a convenient location not too far from Hilo, or the great restaurants in Pahoa, Even better than the place, Liz, the owner, is a treasure trove of information when it comes to things to do on the Island, she will send you an itinerary that lets you know everything you need to know or do on the Big Island.

It was a very relaxing and quiet stay at the Hawaiian Jungle Hut. It is about 30 mins. drive to Volcano National Park in Hilo. It was clean and tidy and very easy to check in and out. Liz was very informative about things to do around the area and mentioned places to eat and events that was going on. She was very helpful.

The Jungle Hut is much bigger than the name implies. It is surrounded by a rainforest and you can hear the soothing sound (in my opinion) of frogs at night. 
Liz is an amazing resource in exploring the area and finding things to do that you won't find via (Hidden by Airbnb) . I'd pay attention to her suggestions.  We stayed at the Jungle Hut for 3 nights and enjoyed our time there. Thank you Liz.

I loved my stay at the Hawaiian Jungle Hut! Liz was a fantastic host, even though we never met face to face she was easily reachable and had tons of great ideas for my first time in Hawaii. The Hut was clean and well stocked, everything that you could need for a comfortable stay. It was a little off the beaten path but that is part of its charm, I loved the fact that all you could hear were the birds and frogs at night and Liz's directions to find it were right on the mark! I highly recommend the Hut and would definitely stay there again.
 Mahalo Liz!

This was the second time I stayed at Liz's Jungle Hut.
Nothing changed - everything is excellent. Nice and cozy interior, a lot of useful tips from Liz and transparent check in/check out process.
Highly recommend this place for everyone (except those who really want to live very close to Hilo).

Thank you Liz for a wonderful stay at the Hawaiian Jungle Hut! First I would like to say that the place is a lot roomier with many more amenities than the name implies. It was perfect size for my boyfriend and I. Liz was gracious enough to give us a ton of tips for local activities, food places, and much more. Great place for a great price!
We enjoyed our stay in jungle hut. The hut is really spacious and well furnished. And Liz, the host, is very kind and attentive.

What an excellent stay!  The apartment is very comfortable, and quite roomy!  Liz was incredibly helpful... she sent me personalized suggestions for activities and events to check out during my stay, and was very accommodating when I asked to extend my visit.  The welcome wine was, indeed, very welcome as well!  The kitchen has just about any appliance you would need for basic cooking, and the carport outside the entrance to the apartment is very handy when unloading your luggage or stocking your car for a day's adventure.  I got rained in one day, and very happily spent the morning drinking coffee in the window seat and watching the weather.  Good value for proximity to Hilo and Volcano!

Our stay at the Hawaiian Jungle Hut was lovely. At nighttime it was truly like being in a jungle with all the animal sounds. Liz was very helpful and informative about happenings on the island. We really appreciated her help!
Everything was great.  Liz was very responsive and informative about what to do and see in the area.  The junglehut was clean and comfortable, with plenty of space.

This was our first Airbnb experience and we loved it!  Liz provided us with a myriad of activities to browse from, clear indications and a nice welcoming package.  The pictures don't do justice enough to the hut, it's wonderful and very spacious, especially the nice living room.  Everything is very comfortable and the jungle hut is really well equipped. The chant of the frogs at night was relaxing, a change of paste.  When the propane tank ran out whilst cooking, it was immediately changed the morning after, response was stellar.  Location wise, it's ideal to explore the Puna region but a good 25 minutes to reach Hilo, but definitely worth it.  We highly recommend the jungle hut and Liz was a really nice host, overall... awesome!

Liz called me when I got to the island. I had a bit of an issue with my car rental and she was very sweet and empathetic toward me. I felt bad she had to listen to that…
I appreciated her call and it was reassuring to hear how friendly she was.
Prior to the trip Liz send emails out with lists of things to do and places to go. There were things on there I had already intended to see but many others I would not have known about. I really loved that since I like to see how local ppl live in the places I go to (I'm not a resort person).

We really enjoyed staying at Liz's place. It was very peaceful and off the beaten path, which was exactly what we were looking for. The use of a washer and dryer made it a great place to land in the middle of our trip. We also enjoyed the wine and chocolate. :)

This place is super lovely and cozy. It is very spacious, with a lot of things including washer dryer, even snorkeling gears!! Liz is very helpful and sent us lots of info before the trip. Location is convenient as well. Next time we will come and stay longer!!
The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Liz's place was great. Close to downtown Pahoa, quick drive from Hilo, and nicely secluded down a quiet drive. We really enjoyed the nearby thermal pool and having drinks at the local Kava bar. Thanks for all the great tips Liz.
Great host and extremely clean and comfortable. Liz was easy to communicate with and have great tips to exploring the island. Will definitely stay again.
Quiet and peaceful home away from the tourist crowd. I felt I was living like a local.

The Jungle Hut was perfect for our stay. If you want a secluded quiet place to stay on the Hilo side of the Big Island this place is for you. It's about 25 minutes from Hilo at the end of a half mile smooth dirt road (easy to navigate with a 2 wheel drive car) This place is perfect for one or two with everything you need to be comfortable. We stayed for over two weeks and never felt that we lacked for anything. The town of Pahoa is a few miles away and is a great funky place to visit and eat. Do your food shopping at the supermarket in Keaau. It's the best one nearby although you can go to Longs drugs in Pahoa and pick up the basics. If you are a very light sleeper the tree frogs peep at night and the occasional rooster crows at random but hey! It's the jungle! We loved it!

We loved staying at the Jungle Hut! It was very secluded and peaceful. You could hear the birds during the day and tree frogs at night. You could also see a lot of stars since the neighborhood is in a rain forest. Liz was very  responsive in answering our phone calls and made the whole process very easy. The house was clean and we got chocolates and wine upon arrival, which was a great house warming gift.
We got all needed information about the place and surroundings, so we're feeling like coming to the place we have known already.

We stayed in the HawaiianJungleHut for 3 days and enjoyed this quite place. Liz gave us suggestion about activities all over the island, that helped us a lot. If you're looking for a nice place in the jungle, this is it.

We had a great stay at the Jungle Hut! Liz was very communicative and provided a lot of information and suggestions about what to do in the area. Chocolates and wine were a nice touch on arrival. The hut is a little off the beaten bath, but convenient to get to Hilo (~20 minutes if I recall correctly) and Volcanoes national park (~45 minutes I think). Lots of cookware and utensils, but if you plan on preparing meals you'll need the little ingredients (oil, condiments, etc.). Definitely on the rainy side of the island, and it feels kind of damp inside - my girlfriend found this a little unpleasant but I didn't really notice. Bring earplugs if you want to sleep in - you're in the forest, lots of early morning birds!

Liz est une personne organisée, sympatique et accueillante. Elle avait même préparée un programme pour nous.
Accueil avec vin et chocolas.
Le logement est fonctionnel et près des routes principales.

The vacation rental is conveniently located if you plan to spend more time on volcanoes national park and warm pools. It is located at the east side of the island so it takes 2 hours to go to the west side of the island. We prefer the more tranquil east region of the Big Island so this vacation rental is just right for us. The house is very clean, you can even walk around with bare feet. The owner has even prepared a bottle of red wine and 3 gallons of water for us. The mattress is comfortable and sufficient for 2. If there is one thing I wish the owner can improve on is to install non-transparent curtain so the people won't be able to see through from the outside at night. Overall, we highly recommend Hawaiian Jungle Hut to everyone.

Liz was a great host and provided a lot of local information and she responded to all my questions promptly. The jungle hut is such a great place to stay! It is very spacious and has everything you need, even snorkeling gear. It is in a good location - close to shops and store and tidal ponds and beaches. It is also very private, so you wont hear traffic noise at all. The rain can however get loud over the bedroom. There is an additional rental agreement to sign and the door code is sent the day of check in. In my case, this was a bit stresfull because I was already on vacation and only had an international phone, but everything worked out in the end. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone!
Staying at jungle was a great great great experience in my whole trip. i felt very relax and interested in everything surrounding the neighborhood. Thank you Liz!!

Exceptional host and excellent hospitality !

We had a great time staying at Liz’s Hawaiian Jungle Hut, it was a perfect get-away for our 2nd anniversary trip! Liz was very meticulous with providing us with all the local information. Her suggestions were apt for the duration of our stay. Liz was just a phone call away and responded promptly. 

Hawaiian Jungle Hut  is true to its name, it is located in the rain forest of Big Island, you sleep to the sound of elements and rise to the chirping of birds :). Very nice and peaceful place to layback and relax. We were welcomed with a bottle of red wine and hawaiian made chocolates. The house is beautifully decorated, very clean and equipped with everything that you need.

We had fun staying at Hawaiian Jungle Hut! Thank you for having us Liz. We highly recommend Liz's place! mahalo

A wonderful house beautiful surroundings & accommodating host. Great location out of the city of Hilo but close to great sites, beaches & volcano. Perfect for those who want a chilled out, homey place xx

She made us feel welcome by contacting us prior to the visit and providing a great itinerary.

It really feels like a jungle hut - with sounds of frogs at night and chickens crowing at 3am!

The "Hawaiian Jungle Hut" is the smaller part of a house that lies at the very end of a street in the "Hawaiian Paradise Park".

Upon booking, Liz supplied us with a wall of text containing a lot of information about nearby places and recommendations.

On arrival, we didn't meet Liz nor the neighbours who were taking care of the property, but were welcomed by three cute, yet shy little green lizards and a house-warming gift.

The inside of the Hut was very spacious, nice, comfortable, clean and looked amazing. 

Be sure to explore the garden, which contains some interesting plants and fruits. There are also some places of solid lava.
In the day, there are small neon-green lizards sticking to every wall of the house. They are shy but will try to slip inside. 
At night you will hear a myriad of frogs, which are pretty loud, yet didn't disturb our sleep at all.

La maison de Liz est superbe, dans un environnement enchanteur. L'hôtesse a fait preuve de plein de petites attentions (chocolats et vin) et s'est montrée très aidante lorsque nous l'avons contactée à la toute dernière minute pour réserver. Elle fut facile à contacter et a accepté de nous accommoder en prolongeant la réservation initiale d'une nuitée. 

La maison est charmante. Il importe toutefois de savoir qu'elle est plutôt excentrée. Ceci ne pose toutefois pas de réels problème lorsque le transport se fait en voiture. 

Je recommande chaudement, tant pour la maison en tant que tel, que pour l'hôtesse exceptionnelle qu'est Liz.

The hut is extraordinary! Super clean, spacious, well decorated and it feel like you want to stay in this homey place for an entire day! :)
Liz is really nice and welcoming. She prepared a schedule to guide us and provide us allllllll the things we could do around on our dates there!! So sweet!
If you want intimacy, it s the perfect place. Thank you very much again Liz!

I had a great time in the Hawaiian Jungle Hut. It is a good place to explore the island and to get a feeling of what the Hawaiian jungle is like. Liz is a awesome host, reponds fast and gives you a lot of information and personal advice what to do on the island.

We had a great experience staying at the Jungle Hut. It is in the middle of the rainforest so we were surrounded by trees, flowers, and animals which we loved. We liked its location as it is in between Hilo and Pahoa and easy to go to all the areas we want to explore on the east side of the island. Liz is a great host who provided us itinerary prior to our arrival. It includes a lot of local activities and restaurant recommendations. We definitely refered to her itinerary throughout our trip. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes to explore and want to avoid busy touristy areas.

I really enjoyed staying at the jungle hut. You get everything you need for planning daytrips on the Island or just going for a lazy day at the beach. Convenient and secluded location not too far away from either the city of Hilo or the Volcano National Park or the Puna Coast.
Did not meet Liz, but she gives you outstanding details on what you can do in the area by mail and she was allways available by phone or messages.

Liz had stuff waiting for me.  It was nice.  During my stay, the smoke detector was running low on battery and there was no ladder to remove it.  Though she wasn't around, she contacted a friend who went in and took care of it.

Nice ace, everything was as described. I did not meet Liz but she was very responsive to my questions through e mails. The apartment was well furnished and lose to the volcano park. It was very quiet and I enjoyed listening to the birds. Thanks for the chocolates.

The jungle hut was really cool. You feel you are in the middle of nowhere and you'll hear all sorts of animals, birds and other "things". The mosquitos weren't even that bad even though it rained quite a bit. The location will get you to any place on the island between 1-2 hours. If you have limited time to explore the entire island (2-3 days) I would recommend picking more spots to overnight to optimize travel time. But if you have a week, this was a great spot! And you have an home all to yourself with everything in it.

Five stars for Liz! Due to a sudden and unexpected health challenge, we were unable to stay at the Hawaiian Jungle Hut as planned, and Liz was truly kind and understanding about it. She is also a tour guide extraordinaire, providing a thoughtful and thorough insider's list of places and activities to enjoy during your stay on the Big Island. Mahalo nui loa to Liz.
It's a nice experience staying in Liz place which has large space and everything we need. The weather is humidity in Hilo and there were some small animals in the forest  shared the place with us.

This place is a hidden gem in the eastern part of Big Island. The location is perfect!! close to the Volcanic National Park, Hilo, Pahua Village and Uncle Roberts. Dint have any issues in locating this place even though we reached there at 9 pm and it was pitch dark. Liz is absolutely amazing as she had literally planned the complete stay for us with her detailed itinerary. The local places that she suggested were outstanding (ensure that you don't miss visiting Uncle Roberts Farmer market that takes place on Wednesday).  
Thanks Liz for everything!!!

I made a silly mistake and booked this rental for the wrong dates - I planned to travel in Feb, not Jan, and I was ignorant of the fact that I made such a mistake. Liz, however, tried her best to reach me and make sure that I was okay. She really went out of her way to do so, and I appreciated that. She was also very understanding after I explained the situation. I was hoping to still stay with Liz during my real travel date but unfortunately Jungle Hut was booked for Feb. I am sure Liz is a great host!

I arrived during the daylight hours and was able to get in without a problem - the owner was nice enough to get me up with the combination code.  So no stressing about the time of day or night I would arrive - phew. The place was quite large and spacious....and the unique decorations added whimsy to the 'jungle hut' feel. Enjoyed my stay.  The nice bottle of wine and chocolates were such a nice treat to have....thank you.

Liz was a great host. She was very communicative. Before our trip, she asked what we were interested in doing while in Hawaii and sent an enormous list of suggestions and events. During our stay, there was a problem with the water and she not only let us know about it immediately, she also got it fixed in less than a day. Her space was a great home base for stuff on the Hilo side of the island. I have nothing but great things to say!

Liz is one of the best hosts I have had the chance to interact with and the listing is a gem on the Hilo side of Big Island. The hut is perfectly located and gives you great access to all points of interest in east part of the island. Just to abide by review guidelines let me begin by saying that the listing description is very accurate and no surprises on check-in. Liz provided us with the access code and also clearly pointed out the parking space that would be most convenient for us (in terms of loading/unloading and access to entry :)). We were welcomed by a bottle of wine and a  box of chocolates that were a treat after the long flight ;). The decor and the collection of artifacts inside the hut is very impressive. The kitchen was fully equipped and she had provided us with more than enough linen and beach towels that we would need for our 10 day stay. As others have already mentioned, Liz did take time to prepare a custom itinerary based on our interests with tips that only a local would know. Given we had limited cellular reception (hey you are in a vacation who needs to be always connected :)), the fast wi-fi at home was very helpful to plan some parts of the itinerary.
Overall we had a lovely experience. Thank you Liz! :)

The Jungle Hut was a unique experience that we will always remember. Liz gave us great directions to the hut, as well as suggestions for a daily itinerary, all of which were extremely useful during our stay on the Hilo side of the Big Island. All the amenities you need are there, including a collapsible cooler, a shade tent for the beach and even big spray, which came in handy. A truly Hawaiian experience, complete with colorful  geckos and tropical birds calls surrounding the hut 24/7.

PRO: calm & nice neighbourhood, very good price quality ratio, quick and responsive host who will provide you with a lot of tips in the area and already on your drive towards the jungle hut.

CON: coqui frogs can be really loud in the evening (I was glad that I'm not too sensitive to that), the hut has a bit of a damp smell but don't get me wrong this comment and as well the one about the coqui frogs is not meant as negative criticism against the host. it's more the area on the east coast of big island which is very rain foresty and wet.
Liz war sehr hilfreich und gab Tipps via Email. Wohnung war gut und mit (Hidden by Airbnb) maps einfach zu finden. Preiswert.

We loved our stay here. Easy to find, great location, and VERY comfortable and spacious and clean. At night you can fall asleep to the sounds of nature, very cool. We also saw a boar roaming around with a little baby boar! It was such an amazing experience to stay here and Liz was amazing even though we didn't meet her, she was in constant communication before our stay, gave us great suggestions as well as a suggested itinerary for our (Website hidden by Airbnb) was what all Air BNB hosts should strive to be! When I come back to the area, I hope this place is available :)

The Jungle Hut is a super cool home - beautiful, exotic, rich decorations in a home deep in the 'jungle' just shy of Pahoa on the Hilo side. I have stayed here before - previously with my mom - and loved it so much I knew I wanted to come back. This time I brought my husband, who before our stay was even half over said he was going to be sad to be leaving our Jungle Hut. Coqui frogs to sing you to sleep, friendly geckos nearby to eat any pesky mosquitos, and when the sun goes down it's like being in a deserted jungle. So peaceful! 
Liz has everything you need here, from the covered parking to the cozy bed in the nook, to the kitchenette with full fridge and tiki bar table, private bathroom with tub and shower, all the amenities like soap and shampoo, and very thoughtful 'welcome' gifts to kick your stay off right and set the right mood for relaxation! (You'll love it!) The fan is helpful when it gets a bit muggy, and if needed there's an A/C unit, too.
You'll want to explore the Hilo side from here - easy, equal distance to Hilo and Volcano, and nearby Pahoa has quick shopping and a few restaurants, as does not-so-far-Keeau. (And Liz is great at giving a list of suggestions on what to see or do and where to find the locals' spots!) But as much as you want to explore the island, be sure to save time to just hunker down in the Jungle Hut and relax and enjoy the serenity!
I'd love to say this is a horrible place so no one goes and I can have it all to myself anytime I manage to get back to the Big Island...I'd love to come back again soon!

Liz did a great job of offering recommendations for great activities in the area.  We loved the local black sand beach -I don't think I will ever forget the wild dolphins swimming and playing in the water next to us. The local tide-pools are fantastic for snorkeling and the surrounding area is so lush and green.  We saw wild baby pigs and so many colorful birds right from the window of her house.

I came to the Hilo side of the island specifically to spend some time away from the noise and commercialism of daily life. I got just what I wanted. The house is on a very quiet piece of land where your company is the sound of rain, frogs and the occasional gecko. Oh and the chickens outside. Now understand that this house is a rain forest experience, and a rain forest tends to be active at night. You will not find dead silence at this location. If however you enjoy the sounds of nature then the frogs and rain on the roof will be a peaceful lullaby to rock you to sleep. 
The decor lends itself to the peacefulness of the place, my favorite was the little sitting area by the stairs where if you look closely there is a strip of LED lights you can plug in to add to the ambience. I would definitely stay here again!
Some tips:
- Rent a vehicle that can handle some mud, the last section of road and the driveway can get pretty wet and muddy. 
- Remember that Hilo is very wet, every building I went in had a slight wet smell. It wasn't bad in this place but it is to be expected.
- The internet connection was good enough for me to perform work remotely on the mainland and while AT&T showed 1 bar on my phone it worked just well enough to text. Not so much for voice.
Awesome stay at the jungle house!  Exactly what we needed to get away.  Liz was amazing and incredibly helpful as we planned our excursions.  Would recommend in a heartbeat!

Great place to stay, lovely jungle feel to it, and cool to see seasonal fruit growing in the garden, saw frogs, chickens and geckos.
Wifi was reliable and the noises from the birds and all at night are lovely to listen too .
Liz is a great host with awesome communication and very helpful.
If I come back to Hilo will stay here for sure.

This place is the best thing I have found in Big Island! 

The interior reflects a combination of Western and Asian cultures, making a very unique atmosphere. Being an Asian myself, I felt really at home here and exotic at the same time. 

The house is surrounded by small and big trees and you can see birds singing every morning. The designated parking lot is a huge plus. You don't need to worry about break-ins or theft. Also, the well-established kitchen with a fridge, plates, and a gas stove lets you cook anything you want.

Also, the location is really great. During the stay at Hawaiian Jungle Hut, I went to Mauna Kea Observatory, National Volcano Park, Kapoho Tide Pools, Ahalanui Park, and many more exciting places very easily. I really enjoyed star gazing at Mauna Kea. 

All in all, I strongly recommend this place to my friends. Thanks Liz!

Great value in a gorgeous, private location. The apartment had more than enough room for two people, and we really enjoyed the amenities (TV, movie selection, washer/dryer, etc). Liz also provided many suggestions for food and activities in the area, which we really appreciated. Would definitely recommend!

Lots of space for a good price! Very secluded and quiet location. Well situated between Kalapana, Hilo, and Volcano, although there aren't too many food options very close by. Liz provided us with a great list of recommended places to eat and activities, as well as a calendar of events for our stay.

The Hawaiian Jungle Hut was a great place to stay. It felt just like home. Well equipped, well decorated. Some people don't like the sound of the frogs but it's part of the charm of this place I think. Would love to go back.

We loved staying at the Jungle Hut. It is a large, welcoming, and colorful space. We always felt like we had plenty of room to move around. We made use of the many amenities, including the washer dryer. The surroundings are lush and the house is on a very quiet street. It is a short drive down to the main highway. Liz sent very helpful emails and she was easy to reach by phone. We would definitely stay at the Jungle Hut again.

Liz's place is really nice, really spacious and has everything to have a confortable stay. The place is in a calm spot to appreciate nature and Liz is a very kind person.

The place is in a good spot to visit evrything on the East Coast. Would definitly recommand, it is a good quality price bnb!

The jungle hut is the perfect Hawaiian hideaway for 2 people! It's well-furnished with plenty of space and you do feel like you're out in the jungle due to the secluded area and coqui frogs singing at night. Liz provides many amenities that make you feel at home, including a welcome bottle of wine and macadamia nut snacks. She's turned the jungle hut into a cozy place where you can hang out, rest, and sleep after a day of adventure. Check it out! :)

The jungle hut was great! Literally in a jungle, we had a rental car so the road to the hut was a bit rough but totally worth it. Everything inside was as-advertised and Liz was easy to get ahold of and very responsive. One word of caution-if you are a light sleeper you'll want to have ear plugs because the jungle is pretty noisy at night. My fiancé and I are heavy sleepers so it didn't bother us, we actually thought it was pretty cool. We would definitely stay here again.

I absolutely loved staying at Liz's place!  It is in a great location conveniently placed between Pahoa and Hilo making it a great jumping point for excursions. The house was very cute and was equipped with everything you could need during your stay.  The house is very cute and comfortable. Liz's land is beautiful, quiet with lots of trees and beautiful foliage. I would definitely recommend this place to friends!  Thanks so much Liz!
Great place!  Had everything we needed for our stay.

Excellent location. Love the keaau/pahoa area. The place was clean, accurately described and above all secluded and quiet. We didn't need to contact Liz during our trip but she assured us she was a phone call away! 10/10

Loved Liz's Jungle Hideaway, as that is exactly how it felt! Hidden away with the sounds of nature. Was a bit concerned after reading reviews, but came prepared with ear plugs. Not needed, I slept amazingly. The hut was roomier than was expected and felt like home. Everything you may need for fun on the beach to exploring lava tubes and caves was available to use. Liz offered several suggestions and provided details on sights and activities, soo helpful!
Communication was perfect.
Would definitely recommend!!

Really enjoyed our stay at the Jungle Hut. The lush green jungle ambiance outside was beautiful! Wild chickens roam the property and geckos and croaky frogs are around everywhere outside. It was a great stay, and would be back again. If you have a late flight leaving ITO airport, buy another night because it's no fun having all your stuff with you from 11am until your 9pm flight and not being able to nap and shower before your red-eye long journey home. Not far from the city of Pahōa or from Hilo. It was a great location to stay at and the Sunday Farmers market is great and local!! Also very close to Makuu Point!
A nice house in the jungle! Thanks Liz for your help and recommendations!!!
Nice place to stay in the jungle. Good location to visit that side of the island. Liz provides a lot of advices for your stay.
Great and spacious place. Near the volcanoes and 2h drives from the kona's beaches. Liz is a great host and you can find everything at her place.

Convenient location for trips to Volcano's National Park, lava flows and generally any activities on the Hilo side.  The Jungle hut was larger than expected and it was a treat having full kitchen and laundry amenities.  Liz wasn't in the area, but took time out to call and check in to make sure I got in ok (much appreciated!).  She also provided lots of nice suggestions for the area. I took her advice on renting a bike to view the lava flow at the crack of dawn and so glad I did - I made it in time to see the flow as well as a beautiful sunrise and double rainbows!
Liz provides you with lots of information about the island and fun things to do once you've booked with her, all around great stay if you like nature and listening to the crickets at night.
